A versatile technique where the user can produce sharp wooden spikes from their body to either fashion short-range weapons akin to a makeshift sword,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 605, pages 9-10</ref> or use them as projectiles, where the branches' growth can be triggered remotely, skewering the enemy as a result.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 605, pages 12-15</ref>

Obito was able to channel this technique through the [[Ten-Tails]]' tails after he and [[Madara Uchiha]] strengthened their control over the beast by connecting to it using [[Hashirama Senju]]'s DNA.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 613, page 7</ref><ref>''Naruto'' chapter 614, pages 6-7</ref>

== Trivia ==
* [[Wikipedia:Cutting (plant)|Cutting]], also called striking or cloning, is a method of plant propagation. It involves cutting off a piece of a plant, usually the stem or root, which is then put in an appropriate medium. If done properly, the cut piece will grow into a new plant, genetically identical to the plant it was cut from.
* When this technique was first performed by Obito, various [[black receiver]]s were scattered throughout the growth of branches that extended from his right side. However, upon deactivating his [[Mangekyō Sharingan]] and the Wood Release Technique, the rods vanished with them.
